title: ggplot2 extended
text:
Welcome
This is the website for my book ggplot2 extended. As the name suggests, the book is about extending the already great functionality of the ggplot2 R package by Hadley Wickham with some of the most interesting extension packages that the great community has put together since the release of ggplot2.
While I will go through the basics of how ggplot2 works in Chapter 1, this book is primarily meant to be read after you have some basic understanding about how ggplot2 works. For learning the basics, I would suggest Hadley’s book ggplot2: Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis (Wickham 2016). The work-in-progress 3rd edition can be read online.
But this book will teach you how to get the most out of ggplot2 and the ecosystem that has been built around it.
This website is and will always be free, licensed under the CC BY-NC-ND 4.0 DEED license. There will be a physical copy of the book, eventually. Stay tuned!
Please note that ggplot2 extended uses a Contributor Code of Conduct. By contributing to this book, you agree to abide by its terms.




Wickham, Hadley. 2016. Ggplot2: Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis. 2nd ed. Springer.

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.

title: 2  Summary
text:
In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.
Testing testing testing testing and testing some more

1 + 1

title: Preface
text:
This book/site is under construction



Everything is liable to change, even the title


“The tidyverse is an opinionated collection of R packages designed for data science.” https://www.tidyverse.org/.
This book is an opinionated compendium of R packages that extend the original ggplot2 by Hadley Wickham. It doesn’t try to be complete as the ecosystem is both wide and deep. The aim instead is to celebrate the great community that is constantly creating fun and useful new ways to visualize data. And since we’re talking about data visualization, show what all is possible.
